jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.description:
About us
Are you looking to join a talented, diverse team, focused on a life-changing mission, at one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech startups? If yes, then you are in the right place!

We’ve recently been ranked number five in Startups100 and named as one of the Top 50 Startups to work for in 2020. 

At Elder, our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We are a team on a mission to fundamentally change what it means to grow old. 

We think a strong team is built through difference. From Mexico City to Manchester, Stockholm to Stirling, Hong Kong to Hull, Elders come from all over the UK and the world. 

It matters that you’re unique. It matters that you’re great at what you do. And, obviously, it matters how much you care about what we do. 

About the role			
The role of the technology team at Elder is to set Elder apart from the rest with meaningful use of technology - our technical platform is the engine powers the rest of the business. We build web applications that connects families and carers with each other and Elder. We use data, algorithms, and machine learning to find the right carer to look after each of our customers. In 2020, we’ll continue our journey towards becoming UK’s leading live-in care provider and do even more to deliver a best in class service.

As a member of the technology team you’ll work closely with a product manager, UX designer, and developer peers to not only build great software, but to shape solutions that support Elder and the families we serve.

What you’ll be responsible for
Working closely with product managers, UX designers, and the wider team to shape technology powered solutions
Implementing, testing, and releasing new functionality across Elder’s web applications
Collaborating with backend engineers in building new APIs and data contracts to support new functionality
Actively participating in code reviews, technology/library selection discussions, and technical design discussions together with your engineering colleagues

Requirements
A solid grasp of modern JavaScript (EcmaScript 6+, Flow or Typescript a bonus)
Experience building software applications using JavaScript/ES6
Experience working with React/Redux, or other similar web application framework
An active interest in staying up-to-date with new technology, new frameworks, new languages and other developments
A passion for working collaboratively to solve meaningful real world problems with technology, not just writing code!


Benefits						 						
We’re a service business and we know that without the best people, we cannot build the best company which is why we treat our team very well. We can offer:

Competitive Salary
Stock Options (We are post-series A & backed by some of the best VC’s in Europe)
25 days holiday + bank holidays
Plenty of socials and team lunches
Amazing office in the heart of the tech scene in Old Street
Macbook + any particular extras you require
AND a genuine opportunity to be a very key part of a high growth business.

Do something you genuinely care about. Join a diverse team of skilled, passionate and progressive people who like to get on with each other. Work at one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. Apply today.

Are you looking to join a talented, diverse team, focused on a life-changing mission, at one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech startups? If yes, then you are in the right place!

We’ve recently been ranked number five in Startups100 and named as one of the Top 50 Startups to work for in 2020.

About the role 

Due to continued growth and success, we are looking for an emotionally intelligent and caring Customer Support Associate to join our lively and driven Operations team with a focus on providing a world-class customer experience. 

Working in a role where no two days are the same, you will be the first point of contact for all inbound calls and emails to assist and support customers on a wide variety of requirements and queries ensuring Elder is always available to customers and our professionals.

Responsibilities 

Managing a range of customer and carer interactions across a wide variety of needs and queries
Provide constructive feedback to management and cross-functional teams to improve the customer journey
Building strong relationships through every interaction to better deliver an exceptional customer and carer experience 
Take ownership and act decisively to solve problems, make your time count, and deliver results

Experience and passion for delivering exceptional customer service even in high-pressure situations
A natural ability to build strong rapport and relationships
Excellent communication skills - both spoken and written
Ability to think outside-the-box in relation to problem-solving and willingness to go the extra mile

jobs.title: Sales Executive
jobs.description:
About us
Are you looking to join a talented, diverse team, focused on a life-changing mission, at one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech startups? If yes, then you are in the right place!

We’ve recently been ranked number five in Startups100 and named as one of the Top 50 Startups to work for in 2020. 

At Elder, our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We are a team on a mission to fundamentally change what it means to grow old. 

We think a strong team is built through difference. From Mexico City to Manchester, Stockholm to Sterling, Hong Kong to Hull, Elders come from all over the UK and the word. 

It matters that you’re unique. It matters that you’re great at what you do. And, obviously, it matters how much you care about what we do. 

About the role			
One of the key ingredients to our rapid growth has been the consultative way in which we sell. The Elder way is strictly no cold calling and no hard selling. All enquiries are warm and inbound.

Our sales method encourages you to build relationships based on mutual respect and understanding. We take time to analyse our customers’ mindsets and their wider socio-political and economic context to help them to really consider all the options in front of them. We advise more than we sell.

What you’ll be responsible for
As a consultant at Elder, you will be dealing directly with families that are enquiring about our service. You will be digging deep to empathetically understand their situation and then using those details to intelligently present Elder as a proposition that fits their requirements, only ‘if’ it fits their requirements.

An analytical and fiercely driven spirit is essential in this role and those who have it will be given ample scope to take control and really shape the future of the business.

Example of job responsibilities will include but not limited to
Consulting inbound customers through their decision-making process
Managing a large pipeline of customers at differing stages in their purchasing journey
Maintaining data integrity using Salesforce.com
Achieving monthly KPI’s

Requirements
You are highly driven with an execution focus, a strong sense of urgency and a belief in our Mission
You are meticulously well planned and understand how vital this is to execute on a plan
You have a track record in successfully achieving KPI’s
You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get the best solution
You deliver customer support like you expect to receive it – with excellence
Energy, positivity and enthusiasm are your hallmarks. You think out-of-the-box and wow people with your interesting angles and quality work

jobs.title: Care Manager
jobs.description:
About us
Are you looking to join a talented, diverse team, focused on a life-changing mission, at one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech startups? If yes, then you are in the right place!

We’re one of the UK’s leading tech companies and have joined FutureFifty 8.0 and named as one of the Top 50 Startups to work for in 2020

At Elder, our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We are a close-knit group on a mission to fundamentally change what it means to grow old. 

That starts by helping people live a healthier and happier life in their own home, with the support of a full-time live-in carer. Our unique matching technology pairs those in need with their ideal carer, based on individual requirements and personality. 

But to join our team, what is it that really matters to us? Well, it matters that you’re unique. It matters that you’re great at what you do, that you put in the hard work. And, obviously, it matters you care as much as we do. 

About the role			
Due to continued growth and success, we are looking for a proactive and customer centred Care Manager to join our fast-growing and driven team. 

Working in a role where individuals’ care needs differ, you will be setting goals with the customer and their carer to ensure that care is customer centred. You will be responsible for delivering and promoting the highest quality of care for a defined group of clients, taking accountability for the clinical oversight of clients, carers and care packages.
This is a great chance to join a fast-growing company who can offer the opportunity for professional and personal development. 
What you’ll be responsible for
Review of and sign off of care appraisal prior to new accounts going live to ensure that there are no red flags and the carers are set up for success
Work collaboratively with our Customer Success team to provide clinical support and feedback as appropriate, signposting to additional support or services as necessary
